Howard Bellamy }} '''The Bellamy Brothers''' are an American [[pop music|pop]] and [[country music]] duo consisting of brothers David Milton Bellamy (born September 16, 1950){{Cite web|url=http://countrymusic.about.com/od/charts/a/blbellamybros.htm|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070212210842/http://countrymusic.about.com/od/charts/a/blbellamybros.htm|url-status=dead|title=Top 100 Country Music Artists of All Time - No. 83 - The Bellamy Brothers|archive-date=February 12, 2007}} and Homer Howard Bellamy (born February 2, 1946), from [[Pasco County, Florida|Dade City, Florida]]. The duo had considerable musical success in the 1970s and 1980s, starting with the release of their crossover hit "[[Let Your Love Flow]]" in 1976, a number one single on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]].{{cite web |url= {{AllMusic|class=artist|id=p1522/biography|pure_url=yes}} |title= Biography |access-date= 2008-04-01 |last= Erlewine |first= Stephen Thomas |author-link= Stephen Thomas Erlewine |work= The Bellamy Brothers |publisher= [[Allmusic]] }} Starting in the late 1970s, the Bellamy Brothers found success in country music as well, charting 20 number one singles, 25 top 10 and more than 50 hits overall on the [[Hot Country Songs|country charts]]. To date, they have released more than 50 albums, primarily on [[Curb Records]]. They have also enjoyed success in continental Europe, with a compilation album topping the [[VG-lista|Norwegian charts]] in 2011 and over two dozen hit songs that were released outside the US market. In 2013, their album ''Bellamy Brothers & Friends: Across the Sea'' landed at No. 5 in the [[Swiss Hitparade|Swiss music chart]] and took the top spot in album sales for weeks in Switzerland.{{cite web|last1=Whitaker|first1=Sterling|title=Bellamy Brothers Score International Success With New Album |date=16 July 2013 |url=http://theboot.com/bellamy-brothers-international-success-new-album/|publisher=The Boot|access-date=19 December 2016}} It was their third major release in Europe in three years.{{cite web|last1=News Desk|title='Bellamy Brothers and Friends' Album Finds Success in Switzerland|url=http://www.broadwayworld.com/bwwmusic/article/Bellamy-Brothers-and-Friends-Album-Finds-Success-in-Switzerland-20130716#|publisher=Broadway World|access-date=19 December 2016}} Their album ''Mermaid Cowgirl'', recorded in Switzerland and released in 2014, won them Gold Record status in Switzerland.{{cite web|last1=Cooke|first1=Sherryjane|title=5 things you didn't know about The Bellamy Brothers|url=http://www.axs.com/5-things-you-didn-t-know-about-the-bellamy-brothers-81493|publisher=AXS|access-date=19 December 2016}} They also recorded four albums in Germany with [[Ralph Siegel]] for release to the European market.{{cite web|title=The Bellamy Brothers & Friends - Take Me Home CD|url=http://www.cduniverse.com/search/xx/music/pid/1014968/a/take+me+home.htm|publisher=CD Universe|access-date=19 December 2016}}{{cite web|title=The Bellamy Brothers: Fly Me To Eden|url=https://www.45cat.com/record/nc318101de&ei=1|publisher=45 Cat|access-date=19 December 2016}}{{cite web|title=Bellamy Brothers|url=http://www.americanradiohistory.com/Archive-Billboard/90s/1991/BB-1991-12-07.pdf|publisher=American Radio History|access-date=19 December 2016}} ==Early life== David and Howard Bellamy were inspired by many musical sources from an early age. Their father played [[country music]] around the house, and was also a member of a local [[Western swing]] band; in addition, they were inspired by the [[rock and roll]] music their sister played. Despite having never had formal music training, both brothers learned how to play [[guitar]], [[mandolin]], and [[banjo]]. In addition, David learned [[accordion]], [[fiddle]], [[organ (music)|organ]], and [[piano]]. Their first musical gig was in 1968 at a benefit concert with their father in [[San Antonio, Florida]], at the Rattlesnake Roundup.{{Cite web|url=http://www.thecountrystage.com/artists/BellamyBrothers/bio.htm|title=Bellamy Brothers - Biography|website=Thecountrystage.com|access-date=October 17, 2019|archive-date=March 21, 2005|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20050321201034/http://www.thecountrystage.com/artists/BellamyBrothers/bio.htm|url-status=dead}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.bellamybrothers.com/up_close.htm|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070515143050/http://www.bellamybrothers.com/up_close.htm|url-status=dead|title=BellamyBrothers.com : Up Close|archive-date=May 15, 2007}} In the late sixties the brothers and their band played for dances at the Dade City Civic Center and at Louie's in Brooksville. They played as The Accidents and later as The Heterogeneous Grouping, performing covers of many of the popular rock and roll and [[Rhythm and blues|R&B]] tunes of the time. Three of their favorites were "[[A Whiter Shade of Pale]]", "[[My Girl (The Temptations song)|My Girl]]" and "[[Little Bit O' Soul]]". Their first paid gigs were playing fraternity parties at the [[University of Florida]].{{cite web|title=Bellamy Brothers|url=http://www.mtv.fr/musique/artistes/the-bellamy-brothers/hzp1f5|publisher=MTV.FR|access-date=19 December 2016|archive-date=20 December 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161220170544/http://www.mtv.fr/musique/artistes/the-bellamy-brothers/hzp1f5|url-status=dead}} Soon after, the brothers moved to [[Atlanta]] and formed a band called Jericho. However, playing in bands and clubs proved tiresome for the brothers, who soon moved back home. The brothers were soon noticed by a friend of recording artist [[Jim Stafford]], who eventually recorded "[[Spiders & Snakes (song)|Spiders & Snakes]]", written by Stafford and David. "Spiders & Snakes" went on to become a top five hit, providing the Bellamys with the money to move to [[Los Angeles]]. Howard became a [[road manager]] for Stafford. ==Music career== ===1970s=== The duo signed to [[Curb Records]] in 1975. A single featuring only David, "Nothin' Heavy", was unsuccessful. However, at the suggestion of [[Neil Diamond]]'s drummer Dennis St. John, the brothers recorded and released the single "[[Let Your Love Flow]]", written by Diamond's roadie Larry Williams. Released in 1976, "Let Your Love Flow" was a No. 1 single on the U.S. [[Mainstream Top 40|pop charts]], as well as more than a dozen countries worldwide.{{Cite web|url=http://www.luckmedia.com/bellamybrothers/biography.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090928090308/http://www.luckmedia.com/bellamybrothers/biography.html|url-status=dead|title="DUETS WITH THE DUET": THE BELLAMY BROTHERS HOOK UP WITH COUNTRY SUPERSTARS FOR LONG-AWAITED ANGELS & OUTLAWS VOL. 1, ON CURB RECORDS, MARCH 29|archive-date=September 28, 2009}} Although "Let Your Love Flow" was also a hit on the [[Hot Country Singles & Tracks]] chart, the Bellamys' country music success was limited until 1979, when "[[If I Said You Have a Beautiful Body Would You Hold It Against Me]]" was released. The song, with its ''[[double entendre]]'' title derived from a [[Groucho Marx]] quote,{{Cite web|url=http://www.songfacts.com/detail.php?id=7458|title=If I Said You Have a Beautiful Body (Would You Hold It Against Me) by The Bellamy Brothers|website=Songfacts.com}} landed the Bellamys their first country music No. 1 in the United States. It was first played on radio in the United Kingdom in [[Northern Ireland]] in 1979 and went on to become Record of the Year in the UK in 1979.{{Cite web|url=http://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/news/local-national/article2514572.ece|title=Bellamy brothers are coming ... so don't hold that song against them|website=Belfastelegraph.co.uk|access-date=October 17, 2019}} In a 2003 issue of ''Country Weekly'' magazine, the title was named the number 1 country [[pick-up line]] of all time.{{cite web|title=Top 10 Pickup Lines in Country Music|url=http://theboot.com/pick-up-lines/|publisher=The Boot|access-date=21 December 2016}} ===1980s and 1990s=== After the success of "If I Said You Have a Beautiful Body Would You Hold It Against Me", the brothers continued with a run of country hits, including tunes such as "[[Redneck Girl]]", "Santa Fe", and the social commentary pieces "[[Old Hippie]]" and "[[Kids of the Baby Boom]]". ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' named the Bellamy Brothers as Top Country Duo, and they eventually went on to set the record for most duo nominations from both the [[Academy of Country Music]] and [[Country Music Association]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.classicbands.com/BellamyBrothersInterview.html|title=Gary James' Interview With Howard Bellamy Of The Bellamy Brothers|website=Classicbands.com|access-date=October 17, 2019}} The brothers worked on a number of collaborative efforts with other musicians during this period. They recorded "Too Much Is Not Enough" with [[The Forester Sisters]] in 1986{{cite web|title=Bellamy Brothers & The Forester Sisters - Too Much Is Not Enough| date=12 March 2009 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y-IvEnIdQ3M |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211213/Y-IvEnIdQ3M |archive-date=2021-12-13 |url-status=live|publisher=YouTube|access-date=21 December 2016}}{{cbignore}} and "[[Drive South]]" with them in 1990.{{cite web|title="1990" "Drive South", Forester Sisters & Bellamy Brothers|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XEWi_ArYHqs|publisher=YouTube|access-date=21 December 2016}} In 1993, they recorded "Stayin' in Love" with [[Freddy Fender]] and [[Flaco JimÃ©nez]].{{cite web|title=Freddy Fender & The Bellamy Brothers| date=10 March 2012 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=44Nm2LAOeoY |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211213/44Nm2LAOeoY |archive-date=2021-12-13 |url-status=live|publisher=YouTube}}{{cbignore}} In 1997, they recorded "Catahoula" with [[Eddy Raven]] and [[Jo-El Sonnier]],{{cite web|last1=Evans Price|first1=Deborah|title=Bellamys Take a Step Over the Line|date=1997-05-24|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=fA8EAAAAMBAJ&q=Catahoula+with+Eddy+Raven+and+Jo-El+Sonnier+and+bellamy+brothers&pg=PA36|access-date=21 December 2016}} while in 1997 they recorded "Everyone's Somebody's Darlin'" with [[Nicolette Larson]]. In 1999, they recorded "(Don't Put Me In) The Ex Files" with [[Buck Owens]],{{cite web|title=Dont Put Me In The X files (Bellamy Brothers featuring Buck Owens)| date=6 July 2014 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kex7zl4WVSA |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211213/Kex7zl4WVSA |archive-date=2021-12-13 |url-status=live|publisher=YouTube|access-date=21 December 2016}}{{cbignore}} and that same year they recorded "Vertical Expression" with Freddy Fender and then with [[Eduardo Araujo]].{{cite web|title=Vertical Expression of Horizontal Desire - The Bellamy Brothers featuring Freddy Fender| date=3 June 2011 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OIx7EyqlqVY |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211213/OIx7EyqlqVY |archive-date=2021-12-13 |url-status=live|publisher=[[YouTube]]|access-date=21 December 2016}}{{cbignore}} In 1991, the Bellamys switched to [[Atlantic Records]]. Their tenure there produced one album before the duo formed their own label, Bellamy Brothers Records. They were one of the first country music artists to have their own record label, and have been licensing albums from their own record label for 25 years.{{cite web|last1=Erlewine|first1=Stephen Thomas|title=Artist Biography by Stephen Thomas Erlewine|url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/the-bellamy-brothers-mn0000037026/biography|publisher=All Music|access-date=19 December 2016}}{{cite web|title=Bellamy Brothers|url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/the-bellamy-brothers-mn0000037026|publisher=All Music|access-date=19 December 2016}} In 1999, they switched to Blue Hat Records for their ''Lonely Planet'' album. ===2000s=== In 2005, the Bellamys returned to Curb Records to record ''Angels & Outlaws, Volume 1'', a compilation album featuring re-recordings of the duo's older hits with additional artists, including [[Dolly Parton]], [[George Jones]], [[Alan Jackson]], [[Tanya Tucker]] and [[Montgomery Gentry]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.luckmedia.com/bellamybrothers/pressrelease.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070623201054/http://www.luckmedia.com/bellamybrothers/pressrelease.html|url-status=dead|title=Luck Media & Marketing INC.|archive-date=June 23, 2007}} A re-recorded version of "If I Said You Had a Beautiful Body Would You Hold It Against Me", featuring Dolly Parton, spent one week at No. 60 on the ''Billboard'' [[Hot Country Songs]] chart in 2005. In March 2007, "Redneck Girl" was covered by [[Blake Shelton]] on the soundtrack to ''[[The Dukes of Hazzard: The Beginning]]''. The Bellamys released an album of [[gospel music]], titled ''Jesus Is Coming'', on May 8, 2007.{{Cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/music-christian-dc-idUSN2023183320070521|title=Bellamy Brothers celebrate outlaw gospel spirit|date=May 21, 2007|website=Reuters.com|access-date=October 17, 2019}} Its title track was previously recorded on ''Native American'' in 1995. The album received two [[GMA Dove Award|Dove Award]] nominations, and a second gospel album, ''Pray for Me'', was released in 2012.{{cite web|last1=Conaway|first1=Alanna|title=The Bellamy Brothers to Release New Gospel Album 'Pray for Me' on September 4 |date=12 August 2012 |url=http://tasteofcountry.com/bellamy-brothers-pray-for-me-album-release-date/|publisher=Taste of Country|access-date=21 December 2016}} They had many guest singers on this album. Their sister Ginger sang with them on the song "Suppertime", and Deborah Allen sang background vocals with Vicky Hampton on the album. Irish actor and musician Kieran McHugh played penny whistle for the song "Hymn to Him".{{cite web|last1=Evans-Price|first1=Deborah|title=The Bellamy Brothers Pack Emotional Punch on New Gospel Album |date=17 September 2012 |url=http://theboot.com/the-bellamy-brothers-gospel-album/|publisher=The Boot|access-date=21 December 2016}} In 2008, the song "Let Your Love Flow" was used in the [[Barclaycard]] advert for their new contactless cards. The song re-entered the UK singles chart at No. 48 based on downloads, peaked at No. 21 in the pop charts in March 2009,{{cite web|url=http://acharts.us/song/40093 |title=The Bellamy Brothers - Let Your Love Flow - Music Charts |publisher=Acharts.us |access-date=2012-05-03}} and was listed on BMI's list of Top 100 Song of the Century at No. 68 that same year.{{Cite web|url=http://www.musicnewsnashville.com/current_articles/preshias.htm|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091120073620/http://www.musicnewsnashville.com/current_articles/preshias.htm|url-status=dead|title=Preshias' Monthly Column: Music News|archive-date=November 20, 2009}} A cover by Petra Haden was used in a 2010 [[Toyota Prius]] commercial. ''The Anthology, Vol. 1'' was released in 2009 and includes the single "Guilty of the Crime", which is a collaboration with the [[Bacon Brothers]]. The video features [[Shannen Doherty]] of ''[[Beverly Hills, 90210]]'' fame.{{Cite web|url=http://top40-charts.com/news/Country/Bellamy-Brothers-Bacon-Brothers-Guilty-Of-The-Crime--New-Video-Debuts-On-CMT-Pure/49799.html|archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20091129145316/http://top40-charts.com/news/Country/Bellamy-Brothers-Bacon-Brothers-Guilty-Of-The-Crime--New-Video-Debuts-On-CMT-Pure/49799.html|archive-date = 2009-11-29|title = Bellamy Brothers, Bacon Brothers 'Guilty of the Crime' - New Video Debuts on CMT Pure}} Both sets of brothers performed the song together on the [[Grand Ole Opry]] in Nashville, Tennessee, on September 1, 2009. The Life and Times of the Bellamy Brothers''.{{cite news |url=https://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/let-your-love-flow-the-life-and-times-of-the-bellamy-brothers-by-david-bellamy-and-howard-bellamy|publisher=Fox News |date=April 17, 2018|title='Let Your Love Flow: The Life and Times of the Bellamy Brothers' by David Bellamy and Howard Bellamy}}{{cite news |url=https://www.tampabay.com/news/Bellamy-Brothers-let-their-love-flow-on-Pasco-based-reality-TV-show_166871619/|publisher=Tampa Bay Times |author=Phyllis Day|date=April 3, 2018|title=Bellamy Brothers let their love flow}} The Bellamys then released their album ''Over the Moon'' in 2019, which consisted of 14 original songs written and recorded at the Bellamys' studio on their Darby ranch. ==''Honky Tonk Ranch''== {{main article|Honky Tonk Ranch}} In 2018 the brothers became the feature of the reality television series ''[[Honky Tonk Ranch]]'', which aired on the [[Cowboy Channel]], [[RFD-TV]] and now on the Circle Network. The series follows the Bellamys in addition to their friends and family. A second season of ''Honky Tonk Ranch'' aired in 2019. In 2020, the show moved to the [[Circle (TV network)|Circle Network]] where seasons one and two aired along with season three.{{Cite web|url=https://countryrebel.com/bellamy-brothers-honky-tonk-ranch-show-moves-to-brand-new-circle-network/|title=Bellamy Brothers' 'Honky Tonk Ranch' Show Moves To Brand-New Circle Network|date=13 January 2020 }} ==Personal life== In the late 1990s, David's sons Noah and Jesse became active in the music scene and the sons currently perform as the duo [[Jesse and Noah]]. The Bellamy Brothers live in Darby, Florida, on a 200-acre ranch, where they raise [[Brahman (cattle)|Brahman cattle]] and [[American Quarter Horse|quarter horses]], with three generations of their family living in the compound. The ranch is also the location of the recording studio where much of their work is recorded. In 2020, the brothers partnered with Florida [[medical cannabis]] company [[Trulieve]] to produce a signature line of [[Cannabis (drug)|cannabis]] products named "Old Hippie Stash".{{cite press release |date=April 9, 2020 |title=Trulieve Announces Partnership With Iconic International Duo Bellamy Brothers |url=https://finance.yahoo.com/news/trulieve-announces-partnership-iconic-international-160800494.html |location=Tallahassee, FL |publisher=Yahoo Finance |agency=CNW Group |access-date=April 11, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200607040702/https://finance.yahoo.com/news/trulieve-announces-partnership-iconic-international-160800494.html |archive-date=June 7, 2020 |url-status=dead}} Said David: {{Nowrap|"[Cannabis}} has] helped Howard and me on many levels. stationed in [[Bosnia]], and on [[Easter Sunday]] 2000, they gave a concert for American troops in war-torn [[Kosovo]] as well as a concert at a remote camp in Macedonia. In 2014, they toured in [[India]] and [[Sri Lanka]] and made history as the first country music act touring in those Asian countries.{{cite web|title=Bellamy Brothers Make Touring History â€“ First Country Act To Tour India & Sri Lanka|url=http://forthecountryrecord.com/2014/02/20/bellamy-brothers-make-touring-history-first-country-act-to-tour-india-sri-lanka/|publisher=For The Country Record|access-date=19 December 2016}} In 2019 and 2020, the Bellamy Brothers participated in [[Blake Shelton]]'s "Friends and Heroes Tour".{{cite web |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/8497193/bellamy-brothers-interview-blake-shelton-tour-new-album-honky-tonk-ranch|publisher=Billboard|title=Bellamy Brothers Gear Up for Blake Shelton Tour, New Album & Second Season of 'Honky Tonk Ranch'|date=February 9, 2019 |author=Deborah Evans Price}} ==Charities== The brothers have traveled around the world playing benefit concerts for [[United States Armed Forces|American troops]] abroad including performances throughout [[Germany]], [[Italy]], [[Japan]], [[Guam]], [[South Korea]], [[Bosnia and Herzegovina|Bosnia]] and [[Kosovo]]. When they played at [[Camp Bondsteel]] in Kosovo in 2000, it was the first time that the base had allowed a band to play.{{cite web|title=Bellamy Brothers To Brighten Easter For U.S. Troops In Kosovo|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/820021/bellamy-brothers-to-brighten-easter-for-us-troops-in-kosovo/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161225144917/http://www.mtv.com/news/820021/bellamy-brothers-to-brighten-easter-for-us-troops-in-kosovo/|url-status=dead|archive-date=December 25, 2016|publisher=MTV News|access-date=25 December 2016}} In 2011, the brothers supported [[2011 Christchurch earthquake|earthquake]] victims in [[New Zealand]] when they joined the [[New Zealand Red Cross]] and Judy Seale International to raise support through live auctions.{{cite web|last1=Dunham|first1=Nancy|title=Bellamy Brothers Reach Out to New Zealand Earthquake Victims|date=17 March 2011 |url=http://theboot.com/bellamy-brothers-new-zealand-earthquake-auction/|publisher=The Boot|access-date=25 December 2016}} In 2016, the Bellamy Brothers partnered with the [[Susan G. Komen for the Cure|Susan G. Komen Foundation]] to release a video for "Let Your Love Flow."
